channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: $C^1$-Local Flatness and Geodesics of the Legendrian Spectral Distance
item.description: arXiv:2403.10679v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article, we give an explicit computation of the order spectral selectors of a pair of $C^1$-close Legendrian submanifolds belonging to an orderable isotopy class. The $C^1$-local flatness of the spectral distance and the characterisation of its geodesics are deduced. Another consequence is the $C^1$-local coincidence of spectral and Shelukhin-Chekanov-Hofer distances. Similar statements are then deduced for several contactomorphism groups.
item.dc:creator: Simon Allais, Pierre-Alexandre Arlove

item.title: Family Floer theory, non-abelianization, and Spectral Networks
item.description: arXiv:2307.04213v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we study the relationship between Gaiotto-Moore-Neitzke's non-abelianization map and Floer theory. Given a complete GMN quadratic differential $\phi$ defined on a closed Riemann surface $C$, let $\tilde{C}$ be the complement of the poles of $\phi$. In the case where the spectral curve $\Sigma_{\phi}$ is exact with respect to the canonical Liouville form on $T^{\ast}\tilde{C}$, we show that an "almost flat" $GL(1;\mathbb{C})$-local system $\mathcal{L}$ on $\Sigma_{\phi}$ defines a Floer cohomology local system $HF_{\epsilon}(\Sigma_{\phi},\mathcal{L};\mathbb{C})$ on $\tilde{C}$ for $0< \epsilon\leq 1$. Then we show that for small enough $\epsilon$, the non-abelianization of $\mathcal{L}$ is isomorphic to the family Floer cohomology local system $HF_{\epsilon}(\Sigma_{\phi},\mathcal{L};\mathbb{C})$
item.dc:creator: Yoon Jae Nho

item.title: Packing Integral Tori in Del Pezzo Surfaces
item.description: arXiv:2308.09334v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We extend a packing result of R. Hind and E. Kerman for integral Lagrangian tori in $\mathbb{S}^{2} \times \mathbb{S}^{2}$ to the Del Pezzo surfaces $(\mathbb{D}_{n}, \omega_{\mathbb{D}_{n}})$ for $n = 1, \dots, 5$. An integral torus is one whose relative area homomorphism is integer-valued, and we seek a maximal integral packing. By definition, this is a disjoint collection $\{L_{i}\}$ of integral Lagrangian tori with the following property: any other integral Lagrangian torus not in this collection must intersect at least one of the $L_{i}$. We show that one can always find such a packing consisting of only the Clifford torus.
item.dc:creator: Karim Boustany

item.title: WDVV-based recursion for open Gromov-Witten invariants
item.description: arXiv:2402.10542v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We give a computability result for open Gromov-Witten invariants based on open WDVV equations. This is analogous to the result of Kontsevich-Manin for closed Gromov-Witten invariants. For greater generality, we base the argument on a formal object, the Frobenius superpotential, that generalizes several different definitions of open Gromov-Witten invariants. As an application, we prove vanishing properties for open Gromov-Witten invariants on products of projective spaces.
item.dc:creator: Roi Blumberg, Sara B. Tukachinsky

item.title: Symmetric spaces as adjoint orbits and their geometries
item.description: arXiv:2302.09638v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We realize specific classical symmetric spaces, like the semi-K\"ahler symmetric spaces discovered by Berger, as cotangent bundles of symmetric flag manifolds. These realizations enable us to describe these cotangent bundles' geodesics and Lagrangian submanifolds. As a final application, we present the first examples of vector bundles over simply connected manifolds with nonnegative curvature that cannot accommodate metrics with nonnegative sectional curvature, even though their associated unit sphere bundles can indeed accommodate such metrics. Our examples are derived from explicit bundle constructions over symmetric flag spaces.
item.dc:creator: Leonardo F. Cavenaghi, Carolina Garcia, Lino Grama, Luiz San Martin

item.title: Betti numbers and compatible almost complex structures on the Hard Lefschetz condition
item.description: arXiv:2312.16948v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: A special class of symplectic manifolds is those satisfying the Hard Lefschetz condition. The algebraic property of $\mathfrak{sl}_2(\mathbb C)$-module gives a natural constraint on the Betti numbers. However, such a constraint is only necessary, and it is not so clear what condition on the Betti numbers is equivalent to the Hard Lefschetz condition. In this paper, we give some relations between the Betti numbers and the variant Hodge numbers on the Hard Lefschetz condition. In general, we give a sufficient condition on Betti numbers and variant Hodge numbers for any almost K\"ahler manifold satisfying the Hard Lefschetz condition. In particular, we offer an equivalent condition on the first Betti number for compact symplectic $4$-manifolds satisfying the Hard Lefschetz condition.
item.dc:creator: Dexie Lin

item.title: Graphical Symplectic Algebra
item.description: arXiv:2401.07914v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We give complete presentations for the dagger-compact props of affine Lagrangian and coisotropic relations over an arbitrary field. This provides a unified family of graphical languages for both affinely constrained classical mechanical systems, as well as odd-prime-dimensional stabiliser quantum circuits. To this end, we present affine Lagrangian relations by a particular class of undirected coloured graphs. In order to reason about composite systems, we introduce a powerful scalable notation where the vertices of these graphs are themselves coloured by graphs. In the setting of stabiliser quantum mechanics, this scalable notation gives an extremely concise description of graph states, which can be composed via ``phased spider fusion.'' Likewise, in the classical mechanical setting of electrical circuits, we show that impedance matrices for reciprocal networks are presented in essentially the same way.
item.dc:creator: Robert I. Booth, Titouan Carette, Cole Comfort
